data.text:
Young Community

Join us

Young Community

Our young community, called Leaders of Tomorrow, is a unique hand-selected community of over 1.500 active members and 10.000 alumni worldwide. Each year a three folded process ensures a diverse selection of 200 new community members.

Master and PhD students can apply for «The Global Essay Competition». The Top 100 essay writers are invited to the «St. Gallen Symposium » and are accomodated as well to the Leaders of Tomorrow Community. Bachelor students can apply for “The Global Leadership Challenge”. 5 of the 100 participants of «the Global Leadership Challenge» are accommodated to the St. Gallen Symposium. Independently from their acadamic backround, 95 young professionals with outstanding achievements from various fields of industries become part of the Leaders of Tomorrow Community through a hand selected process. We call them our « Knowledge Pool ».

Global Essay

Competition

Compete in our Global Essay Competition and qualify for participation as a Leader of Tomorrow in the world’s premier opportunity for cross-generational debates: The St. Gallen Symposium. The competition is closed for 2024.

Leaders of Tomorrow at the 53rd Symposium

Get to know our 200 Leaders of Tomorrow of 2024: 100 Knowledge-Poolers and the top 100 Global Essay Competition participants.

Leaders of Tomorrow Chapters

Through our Leader of Tomorrow Chapters, the symposium provides a touchpoint for all former and locally present Leaders of Tomorrow and individuals interested in the St. Gallen Symposium.

Impact

A selection of previous Leaders of Tomorrow and Impacts

Two-time winner of the Global Essay Competition and participant in the 44th, 46th, 47th, and 48th symposia, Nat is a social economist, entrepreneur, and speaker and has founded two ventures over the years: Forte and 180 Degrees.

NATHANIEL WARE

Participated as a Leader of Tomorrow in the 49th and 50th symposia. Lubomila is the Founder and CFO of Plan A which provides businesses with carbon accounting, decarbonisation planning, and ESG reporting services. Additionally, she is the founder of the Greentech Alliance-

LUBOMILA JORDANOVA

Participated as a Leader of Tomorrow in the 44th symposium. Srijan is the Co-Founder and CEO of the Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Centre which actively promotes innovations in governance and social enterprises, improves youth participation in national and international development, and betters access to education.

SRIJAN SINGH

Participated as a Leader of Tomorrow in the 43rd symposium. Laura is the CEO & Co-Founder of Shippo. Shippo allows online businesses to partner with shipping services with locations in the USA, Canada, Germany, UK, France, and Australia.

LAURA BEHRENS WU

Winner of the Global Essay Competition of the 49th symposium. Reuben is an economist focusing on sustainability and climate risk in finance. He is currently the Africa regional coordinator for the United Nations Environmental Programme Finance Initiative (UNEP FI).

REUBEN MUHINDI WAMBUI

Full list of past Leaders of Tomorrow

Abhinav Priyam

BITS School of Management

Born and raised in Madhubani, a town adorned with a rich heritage of art and culture on the India-Nepal border, I have always been drawn to the creative domains, a passion that traces back to my formative years. This early exposure laid the foundation for my enduring interest in liberal arts, leading me to pursue history in college. Here, I delved deep into societal nuances and was actively involved in debating, quizzing, and theatre, which sharpened my understanding and appreciation of the world around me. My career aspirations are defined by the desire to make a positive societal impact, continuously learn and face challenges, and find fulfilment in my endeavours.I have recently pivoted towards management education wherein I aim to blend my interests in the liberal arts with the domain of business which has the potential for an enriching career.I cherish the art of storytelling, through all mediums, but especially through words and cinema. The philosophy that simplicity holds profound complexity and is capable of solving all complexities is something which is close to my heart. This belief fuels my passion for creative writing and filmmaking, striving to capture life's nuanced tales. A dream of mine is to explore and share life's untouched aspects through my writing and films, making meaningful contributions both professionally and personally.

Adam Taha Pereira

University of St. Gallen

I am a 23-year-old Moroccan German, pursuing a Master's Degree in Strategy and International Management at the University of St. Gallen.

Aditya Bhatia

SP Jain Institute of Management and Research

I am currently an Operations and Supply Chain MBA student at SPJIMR, Mumbai. I have previously worked at KPMG as a Healthcare Consultant in its Government Advisory practice. I was actively involved in working on Covid-19 Pandemic Management and Outbreak response in the Union Health Ministry of India. I have also work with various International organizations like WHO, ADB, BMGF and other stakeholders during various G20 Health working group meetings as part of India's G20 Presidency in 2023.I have strong interest in following Tennis and Cricket. I also like debating on social and topical issues to have a deep understanding of diverse ideas and opinions.

Aditya Guha

SPJIMR

Aditya is a current student studying management at SPJIMR, one of India's top B schools. He has previously studied Physics at St. Stephen's College, Delhi and the University of Cambridge, serving as a Science Editor at Varsity, before dropping out to pursue his dreams of startup in the Agritech and allied sectors. He has always maintained a penchant for writing and hopes to write a book after creating sufficient impact in the sustainabiliy sector.

Adrian Andersson

Meitner AB

Hey, I'm Adrian Andersson, often referred to as one of Sweden's youngest Serial Entrepreneurs (currently 24 y/o). I started my first business when I was 15. Since an early start in my entrepreneurial journey, I've started multiple businesses, and been through both a bankruptcy and a small exit. I am currently disrupting the EdTech market with Meitner, an all-in-one solution for schools in the K-12 sector, with the core product as a School Management Platform. Meitner has raised €5M in seed from angels and is planning series A in late 2024. We have a goal to start expanding outside of Sweden later this year too.Besides Meitner, I do some early-stage investments (pre-seed), and inspirational speeches for businesses and a lot of students at the high school level about entrepreneurship and going your way in life.I love to meet other interesting and ambitious people to discuss tech, education, and everything that regards shaping the future.

Aiman Bentohami

KPMG, Blikverruimers

I would describe myself as someone that likes to challenge the “status quo”. I am always in for a good dialogue or discussion, even if we dont agree i am always curious about the views of other people.

Aleksandra Reinert

University of Cambridge

Aleksandra is the Director of Engagement at Sigma Squared Society (community of the world’s most ambitious young founders) and the Founder and Managing Director of ĀRYA Foundry (a highly selective, equity-free impact accelerator tailored to early-stage founders in CEE). She is a University of Cambridge graduate, deeply passionate about projects that bring social or climate impact.

Alexis Roberto Dick Caceres

University of Glasgow

I am a dedicated Paraguayan leader focused on public service with a diverse academic background and professional experience. Currently pursuing a master's degree through the Erasmus Mundus Scholarships at the University of Glasgow and the Autonomous University of Madrid, I offer insights into political and social dynamics crucial for tackling democratic challenges. Presently, I am also expanding my expertise in entrepreneurship and innovation through a scholarship at the University of Salamanca.My career is marked by numerous scholarships and accolades for academic excellence and social impact, including my selection as a Young Leader of Ibero-America by the Carolina Foundation and scholarships from the OAS and the EU, among others. My public service journey began in my country, where I emphasised transparency and accountability, and I continued as a project administrator at the UNDP, managing projects in the Democratic Governance Portfolio. As president of a professional association in Paraguay, I championed opportunities for young people and enhanced cooperation between Paraguay and Europe.

Alyssa Go

Peking University

Born in the Philippines, Alyssa is currently based in Beijing, China. She is pursuing her Master of Philosophy and Religion in China Studies at Peking University as a Yenching Scholar and a Bai Xian Asian Future Leaders Scholar. Passionate in bringing about positive change in the world, she is also working on accelerating tech adoption to narrow the digital divide and to uplift people’s lives.

Amanda Sadalla

Serenas

Amanda Sadalla is a Brazilian feminist social entrepreneur and founder of Serenas, a non profit which provides capacity-building for gender-based violence response services and implements anti-sexist educational policies within educational departments across Brazil. Since 2021, Serenas has impacted the lives of 60,000 people across six states in the country. In partnership with the Brazilian Minister of Women, Serenas provides capacity building for the National HelpLine for Domestic Violence and with the Minister of Education and the National Secretary for Digital Safety, in a program focused on Girls and Womens Digital Safety. Amanda has been working in the field of gender based violence and comprehensive sexuality education for the past decade, having worked in the City Council of São Paulo and the São Paulo State Police Academy, several public schools and international organisations such as Unicef and the Malala Fund. She holds a Masters in Public Policy from the University of Oxford and has been recently indicated as a finalist from the UK Alumni Awards, which recognises alumni who have provided distinguished social impact in their home countries. Last year, she was part of the "Women 20 Brazil Delegation", taking Serena's views on gender equality to G20 in India.

Ami Calancea

”I. L. Caragiale” National University of Theatre and Film, University of Bucharest, Aspire Academy

I’m a 24-year-old Romanian student who believes in Art’s power to nurture human understanding and alleviate cultural clashes. I studied Sociology and Political Sciences at the University of Bucharest and I’m currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Filmology in my hometown. I’m about to leave in the U.S. in the fall to pursue another Master’s in Film and Media Studies through Fulbright. Within my research, I'm interested in how content distributed through subscription-based streaming services can facilitate indirect intercultural exchange and allow for openness toward diversity, especially in highly traditionalistic societies such as Romania. I am also a logistics wizard for Aspire Academy, a Romanian educational NGO that organizes leadership programs for exceptional students and young professionals around the world. We hold them every summer in Romania and we invite Ivy League professors and other business professionals as speakers – I encourage everyone to apply as a participant.As for other interests, I love singing, songwriting, traveling, languages, reading (mostly fiction and poetry), activities in nature, (watching) figure skating, the Sims 4, and volunteering and working at film and music festivals. I’m always excited to interact with people outside of my bubble – I find it to be a good exercise for better-understanding others and the world at large. ❤️

Andreas Kuster

Nanyang Technological University

Andreas is a Computer Science Doctoral Student at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore in the Wireless and Networked Distributed Sensing group. His research focuses on resilient and efficient wireless communication for technologies such as LoRa, Wi-Fi, 4G/5G, and Ultra-Wideband. He combines machine learning, signal processing, low-level RTL, and analog electronic design approaches with software-defined radio platforms to build robust and efficient wireless communication systems. Additionally, he serve as the Vice President of the Society of Women Engineers at NTU, supports the electric and software team of the Solar Energy Racers, and acts as Vice President of ETH Cyber Group Alumni.

Andrew Jin

University of Southern California

Andrew Jin is a Doctoral Candidate at the University of Southern California and a US Department of Defense SMART Fellow with the US Army Engineer Research and Development Center. Jin's research focuses on the nexus of public health and engineering to help communities build resilience against extreme climate events. Jin is also a major advocate for STEM Education and Outreach as a nationally recognized moderator for the US Department of Energy's Science Bowl program and a academic success aide at A Place for Youth, a 501(c)(3) serving South Central Los Angeles.

Angshuman Pal

Indiana University Bloomington

Angshuman is a PhD student in Operations Management & Decision Sciences at Kelley School of Business, Indiana University Bloomington. His current research is focused on developing methods for optimal aggregation of forecasts received from a crowd of algorithm-assisted experts operating under a Bayesian regime. His overall research interests lie in applied optimization, Bayesian analysis, and public sector operations.

Anna Zam

Equotee

Anna became a junior barrister to 3 of New Zealand’s leading King Counsel’s but decided cases, arbitrations and ministerial inquiries did not compare to the trials of validating a legaltech start-up to provide greateraccess to justice. Anna is passionate about social enterprise and has been invited to EU twice and most recently shoulder-tapped by the US Department of State for the ASEAN Summit. Shortly after, Anna joined a passion economy network-effect start-up. Anna is proud of her indigenous I-Kiribatian/Chinese heritage and is now working as founder of Equotee, an equity management platform to address climate equity.

Anushka Purohit

Breer

Passionate, proactive and perseverant, Anushka is a young entrepreneur who is also a polyglot, being able to speak 5 languages including Cantonese and Mandarin. Anushka is the CEO and Co-founder of Breer, a food upcycling startup that collects surplus bread from bakeries and restaurants and uses it to brew local craft beer. She has studied Electronic and Computer Engineering at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology and wants to use her position to make a positive difference in the world, inspiring others to do the same. For her work in furthering the cause of women empowerment and making a difference, Anushka has been awarded the Student of the Year Award by SCMP, awarded the Indians of the World Award 2023 at the House of Lords, UK, was crowned Young Achiever of the Year in 2021 by the American Chamber of Commerce in Hong Kong, was listed as a Gen T Honoree by Tatler and has been featured on the coveted Forbes 30 Under 30 List 2023.

Ashif Hassan

Memorial University of Newfoundland

Ashif Hassan (Ash) is a post-graduate independent researcher who has an ardent interest in Forensic Psychology and the Criminal Justice System. Ash believes that interdisciplinary approach is the next step to build a better world for our future generations. In his free time, Ash likes to play and study chess. Ash wants to work as a medical officer in the Canadian Armed Forces.

Assen Plevneliev

Management Solutions

Passionate about creating win-win situations for people, the transformative benefits of Artificial Intelligence (specifically having a brainstorming partner and input-to-task models), geopolitics, and public speaking. Currently working as a full-time management consultant who does event organizing on the side. Happy to meet up throughout the symposium, just drop me a message!

Augustin Ignatov

University of Basel

I am a Ph.D. student at the Faculty of Business and Economics, University of Basel. My research interests include development economics, economic geography, international trade, and applied econometric analysis.

Aurelie Laborde

Columbia University

Aurélie Laborde is an exceptional young professional who is dedicated tofostering professionalism in her various roles as a corporate broker, content creator, and graduate student. Currently pursuing her master’s degree in Sustainability Management at the Columbia School of Professional Studies, Aurélie adeptly combines her academic pursuits with her passion for her Afro-Caribbean heritage. Recognizing the importance of community-based climate advocacy, she actively incorporates her cultural background into her advocacy work, creating a unique and impactful perspective.

Barbora Bromová

Sciences Po Paris

Barbora Bromová has been trained in interdisciplinary social science research at the University of Amsterdam, completing her degree in Politics, Psychology, Law and Economics in 2022 and continuing to pursue Digital Technology & Public Policy at Sciences Po Paris. Outside academia she has delved into the field of artificial intelligence, public sector innovation, and digitalisation for development, conducting research at the OECD Observatory for Public Sector Innovation and developing Czech AI policy and ecosystem with prg.ai.

Basile Narozniak

Swiss Re

Senior reinsurance professional with a growth mindset and a passion for Data & Analytics. Outside of work, I play rugby and cook seasonal meals

Bea Krisha Lee

University of Stuttgart

a Civil-Environmental Engineer committed to make positive a impact to the environment and society

Bhavuk Mittal

Faculty of Law, University of Delhi

A law student who is also registered with the world's second largest professional accounting body, ICAI (India), to pursue Chartered Accountancy course. He was selected as one of the fellow delegates to participate in the HPAIR conference (HCONF-2023) organised by the Harvard University. He has worked for the Organisation de coopération et de développement économiques, OECD-OCDE (Paris) as Stage Fiscalité for a period of 6 months in international taxation division. Before this, he worked as a professional accountant for 3 years serving the Vice-President of the ICAI.

Bibiane Kronemann

Phillips-Universität Marburg

In my freetime I like to do lots of sports with friends and enjoy reading. I love to travel and drink coffee and go running whenever I arrive someplace new.Professionally, I am a last year medical student and do research in primary care for my phd. My interests are education for healthcare professionals and global health.

Billion Promise Agunia

Rivers State University

I am a legal practitioner who is passionate about sustainable development. I have a special interest in petroleum, energy and environmental law, and I desire to leverage my knowledge and experiences in this area of law to assist stakeholders in attaining sustainable development in Nigeria and beyond.

Bryce Chan

Bryson Clark

Fordham University

Bryson Kernan Clark is a designer and entrepreneur driven by a passion for design, life, and justice. Born and raised in Fort Worth, Texas, his enthusiasm for arts and language emerged early, leading him to pursue degrees in Visual Arts and Spanish at Fordham University in Manhattan. Currently enrolled at Fordham's Gabelli School of Business, Bryson explores new ways to foster community engagement and promote sustainable practices. At the St. Gallen Symposium, he is eager to engage in meaningful discussions that confront pervasive injustices, using his background to advocate for systems that prioritize well-being and balance.

Caitlin Tierney

Peking University

Born in the United States, Caitlin graduated summa cum laude from the University of Virginia and is currently pursuing a Master's in China Studies on a scholarship at the Yenching Academy of Peking University. Caitlin promotes international dialogue and connections on campus by working for the Peking University International Students Division as well as the Peking University Office of Global Communications.

Callum Thomas

OECD/Peking University

Callum Thomas is a young international development professional with ambitions to continue driving evidence-based impact across the sustainable finance sector.

Calvin Heng

National Institute of Education, Nanyang Technological University

Calvin Heng is an aspiring educator from the National Institute of Education, Singapore. Besides learning how to win the hearts of his students, he has performed research and published in the areas of Applied History, Arctic Governance/Politics, and Modern Chinese History. He holds an AM in Regional Studies—East Asia from Harvard University (2023) and a BA in History (with a minor in China Studies) from the National University of Singapore (2022).

Calvin Wee

The Young SEAkers

Calvin is currently a student at Tsinghua University, pursuing a Master’s Degree in Chinese Politics and Foreign Policy. He is the sole Singaporean recipient of the ASEAN-China Young Leaders Scholarship 2023. Prior to that, he was a Relationship Manager in a multi-family office serving the needs of clients from China’s technology industry and an Investment Analyst in a $3.3 billion L/S hedge fund focusing on China. Outside of work, he is the co-founder of The Young SEAkers, a non-profit organization that brings together vibrant, competent ASEAN youths who are passionate about advancing the ASEAN-China region. The Young SEAkers is the first and only Southeast-Asia based non-profit with a China and ASEAN angle. It currently has operations in all 10 ASEAN countries and China.For his efforts in The Young SEAkers, Calvin was awarded EDGE’s 30 Under 30 in 2021 and Tusstar’s GO RCEP Tech 35 under 35. Apart from TYS, he is also the Government Relations lead and founding team member of G20 Young Entrepreneurs Alliance Singapore. Calvin is also a member of National Youth Council’s INSPIRIT and HollerCalvin is an alumnus of NUS Business School, graduating with a Bachelor’s in Business Administration (Honours) with a major in Finance. Calvin is also an alumnus of the prestigious NUS Overseas College Program where he was based in Shanghai throughout 2019, studying at Fudan University. He is also the Co-Founder and Vice President of Fudan Entrepreneur Society. Calvin studied in Peking University’s Guanghua School of Management from February to July 2018 under the Fung Scholarship provided by Li & Fung Foundation. Calvin completed multiple internships across various job scopes ranging from Venture Investments, Strategic Development, Private Equity and Equity research. He started his internship journey as an intern in Enterprise Singapore’s China desk and Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office back in 2016.Calvin is a budding learner of Bahasa Indonesia, an avid gym rat, an excited traveller across Southeast Asia and is on the constant lookout for interesting whisky and watches.

Can Arda Senel

Technical University of Munich

Politics and Technology Master's student at TUM, working student at BCG.

Carmen Elisa Mendez Silva

The World Bank

I am an economist dedicated to fostering positive change and sustainable development. Currently, I serve as an Operations Team Assistant at the World Bank, where I actively contribute to impactful projects and development policy loans that address global challenges in the education, health, and social protection sectors. My passion for economics stems from my belief in its power to drive meaningful social and economic transformation.

Celestin de Wergifosse

Signatur Biosciences

Co-Founder and CEO of Signatur Biosciences. The company's mission is to democratize access to precision diagnostics, starting with breast cancer prognosis to ensure that every woman affected by breast cancer can safely decide their treatment course post-surgery. Signatur Biosciences is a spinout from Imperial College London, backed by YCombinator.Startups since the age of 14. First patent at 15. World Intellectual Property Organization "Best Young Inventor 2010". Twice TEDx speaker. Co-founded Young Change Maker, a social startup that highlights inspiring individuals. Co-founded and sold a company called Sauna en Bois. Bio-engineering (medical device) from Imperial College London, later became Entrepreneur In Residence at The Stevens Group (Imperial College).

Chandan Kumar Sah

Beihang University

Hello World! I'm Chandan also Know as Rocky 文浩, originally from Nepal and currently based in Beijing, China. I'm a postgraduate student at Beihang University, studying Software Engineering. Additionally, I'm proud to be a member of the AI policy research group at the Center for AI and Digital Policy in the USA.At Beihang, I serve as the Department Head of Academic & Innovation for the PGSU, contributing to the university's academic excellence and fostering innovation. As an International Ambassador for Beihang University and a WiDS Ambassador for Beijing, China, I am passionate about promoting diversity and empowering in tech.My journey is fueled by a commitment to leveraging the power of AI, Innovation, deep learning and Problem Solving for a greener future. Inspired by nature's wisdom, I am driven to explore AI's potential to uplift society and the planet. Let's embark on this academic journey together and cultivate a world filled with intelligent solutions. Thanks

Chelsi Bansal

S P Jain Institute of Management and Research

I am currently pursuing Post Graduate Diploma in Management in Finance from S.P. Jain Institute of Management and Research, Mumbai.I have previously worked as a Financial Analyst at J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. (Mumbai) in the Financial Planning and Analysis division for 14 months. During my articleship in mid-size firms in Surat, I had the opportunity to have an exposure in various fields including Auditing, Taxation, Income Tax appeals and working for Start-ups.I am a qualified Chartered Accountant and have done my Bachelor's in Commerce from S.D.J. International College, VNSGU (Surat). I was amongst the Top 20 Scorers in CA-CPT and my interest in finance led me to score more than 75% in Financial Management in both CA Intermediate and CA Final.I am very passionate about teaching and mentoring. I have also hosted a few events, including the National Conference by ICAI and Start-up Grind powered by Google. Having volunteered for many social programs and organizations, I have been working with a team of a Surat based mental health organization - The Yellow Umbrella since 2019.

Christina huguet

Eurasia Group

Christina Huguet manages the Consumer & Retail Practice at Eurasia Group, a leading political risk consultancy, where she helps public and private sector organizations understand evolving trends in clean supply chains and supports them to strategize solutions for opportunities. At Eurasia Group, she spearheads the company’s coverage of clean supply chains in trade, focusing on corporate due diligence on issues such as human rights and plastics. She has also been one of the lead authors for three consecutive years of Eurasia Group’s signature annual publication, "Top Risks," outlining the significant global risks anticipated for the upcoming year, focusing on topics such as “Corporates Losing the Culture Wars” (2022), “Tik-Tok Boom” (2023), and “Risky Business” (2024). Prior to her tenure at Eurasia Group, Christina amassed experience in political risk analysis at The Cohen Group, where she delved into similar issues. Additionally, she has undertaken research and consultancy roles for UNICEF Nepal, focusing on socio-political matters, and collaborated with the UN Food and Agricultural Organization on addressing water scarcity challenges. Notably, Christina led the sustainability strategy for developing the Tambling Wildlife Nature Conservation’s coffee line in Indonesia.Christina earned her Master’s in International Affairs from Columbia University’s School of International and Public Affairs and completed her Bachelor’s degree in Political Science and Economics from the University of California, Los Angeles.

Christopher Khajira

Montclair State University

Christopher Khajira is a Data Science Graduate Student at Montclair State University with a profound understanding of Information and Computer Technology. With a deep-rooted passion for effecting positive change, Christopher has been recognized for his impactful initiatives in climate change and social justice. His notable achievements include winning awards such as the Team Up for Climate Challenge Award organized by Egis Foundation and the Future Against Corruption Youth Award organized by Transparency International. Christopher is dedicated to leveraging his technical expertise and social conscience to drive meaningful progress in addressing global challenges.

Daeun Jeong

Korean Embassy Cultural Attaché in Sweden

As an aspiring young professional in the field of green investment and climate finance mobilization, I have worked as a valuable member of the Africa Regional Office at the Green Growth Institute (GGGI) HQ, supporting business development and partnership. My primary focus lies in bridging the climate finance gap between beneficiaries and donors and driving a green economy. Committed to enhancing the well-being of vulnerable communities, I am dedicated to improving their quality of life through impactful projects.My diverse work experiences span consulting firms, UN agencies, and embassies, providing me with a comprehensive understanding of the dynamic landscape of sustainable development and outreach. With a passion for environmental advocacy, my ambition is to evolve into an environmental expert with a profound understanding of the human rights impacts associated with sustainable development. I am enthusiastic about contributing my skills and knowledge to address pressing climate challenges and create a positive impact on a global scale.

Daniel Adeyemi

University of East London

Daniel Adeyemi is a multi-award-winning journalist and the managing editor at Bendada.com. He has worked and spoken extensively with over 200 founders and CEOs, regulators and investors focused on innovation in Africa, covering their activities and providing millions of readers with insightful information to make better decisions. Leveraging his expertise, he's helped over 100 brands improve storytelling and positioning.Daniel is passionate about business, design, storytelling, history, psychology, economics, art and technology. He is an MBA student at the University of East London and an ACCA Chartered Accountant.

Daniel Akinwumi

Space Economy Institute

Daniel Akinwumi hails from Lagos, Nigeria. With a robust foundation in Space Systems Engineering and currently pursuing a Master's Degree in Space Economy, I stand at the forefront of pioneering sustainable and innovative space technologies designed to extend the benefits of space exploration to humanity on Earth. My leadership journey is anchored in the principles of Space Sustainability, pushing the envelope in Space Technology, and leveraging the Space Economy for global advancement. As the founder of DreamerBoy Space Technology, I have channeled my technical acumen and entrepreneurial spirit into establishing a beacon for progress in the space industry.

Daniel Schulz

Climate Services

I have multidisciplinary knowledge on various sustainability topics, with the mindset of Decision Intelligence which encourages to systematize decision making processes. This discipline is rooted in the science of Information Theory. My interests are therefore broad, touching on decision making processes, hypothesis testing, prompt engineering, artificial intelligence, data science, data engineering, agriculture, energy, process optimization, process mining. I'm looking for people in different fields than mine so that I can learn from someone's circle of competence and learn the mental models that they use in their ddaily practice.

Daniela Teplitzki

DATE

I am very passionate person. Having complex challenges triggers me to go for more (and does not paralyze me). To execute complex plans, I work with empathy to generate deep bonds with my team. I have been an entrepreneur for as long as I can remember; I've always enjoyed creating things that people want to buy. In my last startup, I served as the COO and focused on biotechnology. We managed to raise almost 1 million dollars in investment and were selected by the world's top accelerator in the field, IndieBio. All the experience gained from that venture has now prepared me to embark on a new path and pursue my great passion: sustainable fashion.

Danijel Bačan

Faculty of Science and Mathematics, Department of Geography

I am a doctoral student in geography with a specialization in political geography, and I am finishing a specialist study in Foreign Policy and Diplomacy. I currently work as a professor of geography, I lead the Youth Atlantic Treaty Organization of Croatia, the Youth Council of my municipality, and I am a young European ambassador in the Eastern Partnership of the EU. In my free time, I play in a tambura orchestra.

Danwei Lu

Tsinghua University

I am a PhD student at Tsinghua University, specializing in Electronic Engineering with a focus on remote sensing and generative models. My research delves into the innovative intersections of these fields, with a primary goal of advancing the boundaries of image synthesis.Beyond my academic pursuits, I am deeply fascinated by the vast realm of artificial intelligence. I am dedicated to both its technical advancement and the crucial ethical and governance considerations surrounding its implementation. I believe in leveraging AI not only for technological progress but also for the betterment of society, ensuring its responsible and equitable integration. Therefore, I am eager to explore the multifaceted dimensions of AI, from cutting-edge research to its broader societal implications.

David Kinzuzi

Schwarzman College

As a seasoned young professional, I've had the privilege of working across various regions, including Rwanda, China, and Switzerland. Currently, I'm engaged with the UNHCR headquarters in the Division of International Protection (DIP), where my focus is primarily on Resettlement and Complementary Pathways for refugees.In my role, I have developed a comprehensive tracker to monitor the pledges made by countries during the Global Refugee Forum. This involves ensuring that these commitments translate into tangible actions, facilitating the resettlement process for refugees. Additionally, I'm actively involved in organizing meetings such as the Consultations on Resettlement and Complementary Pathways (CRCP), where stakeholders discuss strategies to enhance refugee support initiatives.My linguistic proficiency in English, French, Kirundi, Kinyarwanda, and Kiswahili enables effective communication across diverse cultural backgrounds, facilitating collaboration and understanding. With a master's degree in Global Affairs from Tsinghua University as the first Burundian Schwarzman Scholar and a fellowship in refugees and forced migration studies from the University of Oxford, I bring both academic rigor and practical experience to my work.Previously, I held roles in financial aid administration at the African Leadership University, ensuring equitable access to education, and interned at IOM - UN Migration, where I contributed to projects focusing on migration governance and protection.Driven by a genuine passion for social impact and innovation, I am dedicated to contributing to initiatives that address the complex challenges faced by refugees and migrants worldwide.

David Montani

Sprüngli

Recent MA graduate working as a Business Analyst at Sprüngli AG. Specializing in Ad-hoc analysis of financial and production data using Excel and Python as well as building Machine Learning models for prediction tasks.

Dhruv Aggarwal

WHU - Otto Beisheim School of Management

I believe in people being the core of every successful, impact-driven initiative. Therefore, I am committed to steering businesses and their people to become sustainable, intelligent enterprises as a consultant at SAP.Academia-wise, I have been at Stanford University and WHU for my graduate studies and currently doing my Joint Part-Time MBA with Columbia Business School, WHU and Indian Institute of Management Bangalore. I am also engaged as an Incoming Curator at World Economic Forum's Global Shapers Community and further volunteer responsibilities at organization such as UN/UNESCO, BCG and academic partners. Besides that, I currently work on some Silicon Valley endeavors, which have resulted from my very formative studies at Stanford University Graduate School of Business.

Oxford University

Recognising this gap, she co-founded the Circle of Young Humanitarians (CYH) in collaboration with the ICRC in the spring of 2021, of which she is President.
